timeline.subject: Colatte femme Colas Bertrand
timeline.details: Substitut for PG de Lorraine asks for arrest

timeline.subject: Colatte femme Colas Bertrand
timeline.details: C.M. Rémy asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Colatte femme Colas Bertrand
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - did not confess

timeline.subject: Colatte femme Colas Bertrand
timeline.details: Rémy asks for banishment, but Change de Nancy recommends release

timeline.subject: Colatte femme Colas Bertrand
timeline.details: Released from prison with warnings about future conduct

prior_accusations.context: Went to devin at Orbey after honey theft; devin identified her as witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Colatte femme Colas Bertrand
notable_quotes.french: il est bien mal aysé de pouvoir vivre en paix avec un chacun
notable_quotes.english: it is very difficult to be able to live in peace with everyone
notable_quotes.context: During interrogation, explaining disputes with neighbors

notable_quotes.speaker: Colatte femme Colas Bertrand
notable_quotes.french: elle avoit ung homme moltrin sans deffence qui ne le deffendoit aulcunement
notable_quotes.english: she had a soft husband without defense who did not defend her at all
notable_quotes.context: Explaining to Jean Colin Remy why she could not defend herself against accusations

notable_quotes.speaker: Colatte femme Colas Bertrand
notable_quotes.french: qu'il avoit cui son pain en chez elle l'espace de trois ans et qu'elle estimoit qu'il fusse un de leurs plus grand amis, toutesfois que c'est un malheureux et voit bien du contraire
notable_quotes.english: he had baked his bread in her house for three years and she thought he was one of their greatest friends, yet he is a wretch and she sees the opposite
notable_quotes.context: Confrontation with Jean George de Foinzé

notable_quotes.speaker: Colatte femme Colas Bertrand (under torture)
notable_quotes.french: elle était aussi claire de sorcellerie que les poissons dans l'eau
notable_quotes.english: she was as clear of witchcraft as the fish in the water

notable_quotes.speaker: Colatte femme Colas Bertrand
notable_quotes.french: fille de bourdel, parce que sa mere se laissoit avoir, et jouir d'elle par aulcunes de leur village
notable_quotes.english: daughter of a brothel, because her mother let herself be had and enjoyed by some of their village
notable_quotes.context: Attacking credibility of witness Dieudonnée during confrontation

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Colin Remy
notable_quotes.french: que sy on la prenoit, qu'elle en feroit encor bien suivre des autres
notable_quotes.english: that if they took her, she would make many others follow
notable_quotes.context: Attributed to Colatte (she denied saying this)

relationships.evidence_text: father Claude Jean le Masson was still living at Clefcy
12 years before her first husband Mengeon Colas Parisat
her husband was his wife's brother

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over day labour and economic competition. Witness 5 reported she was envious and said no-one could earn anything on account of Demenge, particularly her husband, and that he was taking away their day labour. Dispute with Georgeon Claudon Colas Claude over borrowed tools not returned and unpaid bread. Dispute over cart manure contract with Claudon Mourice. Accused complained of having 'ung homme moltrin sans deffence' suggesting economic vulnerability.

prior_legal_disputes.description: Claudon Jean Remy lost honey, went to devin at Orbey who identified her as thief and witch
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: She and husband wanted to go to court, but those who heard charges denied having done so

legal_context.redress_outcome: wanted to go to court over devin's accusations but those who heard charges denied having done so

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Rémy asked for banishment, but Change de Nancy recommended she be renvoyée (released)

hearsay_chains.content: heard him say he suspected her after wall fell on him
heard his late father tell his brother Mengeon about suspicions
witnessed quarrel, but could not say for sure Colatte caused death
heard him say he suspected her after wall fell

hearsay_chains.content: heard account of sabbat attendance from her son
heard account from Claudel about sabbat attendance 3 years earlier
husband never heard him accuse her despite illness

emotional_state_notes: non beaucoup estonnée mais fort triste (not very frightened but very sad) when prepared for torture

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: had given a false oath over some wood he had stolen
he had been to the devin to find out about brother's illness, and had blamed her when he could discover nothing
was said to have been a highway robber
she had stolen a scarf and a hat
was a little liar, and had claimed to have found the Virgin Mary
had killed one of his brother's children, and his uncles had to purchase pardon for him
was a little liar, and was 'fille de bourdel, parce que sa mere se laissoit avoir, et jouir d'elle par aulcunes de leur village'
had disputes with him because he borrowed tools and failed to return them, also a sword, and failed to pay for bread
when wall fell on him it was because he was building it in his house, and it was not properly supported (natural explanation)

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial record is relatively complete with detailed witness testimony, interrogations, confrontations, and torture session. Accused did not confess despite torture. Change de Nancy overruled local prosecutor's request for banishment and recommended release. Notable for detailed economic disputes, healing practices (she gave advice to cure cow), and children's testimony about sabbat attendance. Evidence of practiced healing through her advice about bathing cow's thigh and providing bread/salt that cured illnesses (though this was used against her as evidence she caused the illnesses). Document has some damage noted in several places.
